text: Effect of adenovirus 2 on cellular gene activation in blood - derived monocytes and macrophages .

We have investigated the effect of adenovirus 2 ( Ad2 ) infection on human monocytes and monocyte - derived macrophages with regard to expression of <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-1 beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: In monocytes , the virus was bound to the surface without being internalized .
On the other hand , Ad2 was internalized by macrophages .
No virus replication and no transcription of the Ad2 early genes was observed in either of the cells .

Ad2 infection induced transient increase in the mRNA levels for <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-1 beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in both monocytes and in macrophages , although the kinetics of the transcription was slightly different .

text: The production of both cytokines , measured by ELISA tests , was enhanced in monocytes .

In macrophages , a slight enhancement of <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production was seen , whereas <extra_id_0> IL-1 beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was not detected .

text: The data indicate that cellular genes might be activated by Ad2 virus infection in nonpermissive cells where no viral gene products could be detected .
